INGREDIENTS: 

For Marinating Chicken: 
• 500g chicken pieces (bone-in or boneless) 
• 1 cup yogurt 
• 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste 
• 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder 
• 1 teaspoon red chili powder 
• 1 teaspoon garam masala 
• Salt to taste 

For Rice. 
• 2 cups basmati rice 
• 4 cups water 
• 2-3 green cardamom pods 
• 2-3 cloves 
• 1-inch cinnamon stick 
• 1 bay leaf 
• Salt to taste. 

For Biryani: 
• 2-3 tablespoons vegetable oil or ghee. 
• 2 large onions, thinly sliced 
• 2-3 green chilies, slit 
• 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste 
• 1 cup fresh coriander leaves, chopped 
• 1 cup fresh mint leaves, chopped 
• Saffron strands soaked in 2 tablespoons warm milk (optional) 
• Ghee for garnish (optional) 

Whole Spices (for biryani): 
• 2-3 green cardamom pods 
• 2-3 cloves 
• 1-inch cinnamon stick 
• 1 bay leaf 

PROCEDURE: 

1. Wash the basmati rice thoroughly, soak it in water for 30 minutes, and then drain. 
2. Marinate the chicken: In a bowl, combine the chicken with yogurt, ginger garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes. 
3. Cook the rice: In a large pot, bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add the rice, whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and bay leaf), and salt. Cook the rice until it's 70-80% cooked. Drain the water and set the rice aside. 
4. Heat oil or ghee in a large, heavy-bottomed pan. Add the sliced onions and cook until they turn golden brown and crispy. Remove some fried onions for garnish and set them aside. 
5. Add the marinated chicken to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes until it changes color. 
6. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a few minutes until the raw smell disappears. 
7. Layer the biryani: Spread a layer of partially cooked rice over the chicken. Sprinkle half of the fresh mint and coriander leaves. 
8. Repeat the process with another layer of rice and the remaining mint and coriander leaves. Optionally, drizzle the saffron milk on the top layer of rice and garnish with a little ghee. 
9. Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid or seal it with dough to trap the steam. 
10. Cook on low heat for 25-30 minutes until the chicken is cooked and the rice is fully done. 
11. Once cooked, fluff the biryani gently with a fork, mixing the layers. 
12. Garnish with the fried onions you set aside earlier. 

This larger batch of chicken biryani should serve 3-4 members.
